Primary.banReason: Same/better dps then stock in 4s and 6s, with a higher effective range
Insanely high burst damage potential that has the potential to drop fully overhead troopers.
Straight upgrade to stock, allows for faster 2-shot kills, an extra bullet, and faster captures on top of that.

Secondary.banReason: Banned because it increases the time a scout can stay away from a medic with the permanent overheal on kill; it also lets a medic build uber at max rate
Rechargeable get out of jail free card.
Lets flanker bumrush the doctor much quicker.
Allows to jump out of rocket splash radius and gives the flanker extreme mobility while retaining his primary.

Melee.banReason: Lets the flanker get to places he shouldn't without needing to take any flank routes or risky positions.
Blinds you for free, essentially putting you out of the fight until it wears off.
Slows the enemy which can make focus fire and engagements significantly easier without sacrificing anything meaningful for it.
Spammy chip damage projectile that can be thrown out constantly without sacrificing anything.

Primary.banReason: Lets the marksman charge a shot that does almost full damage without having any tunnel vision.
Direct upgrade to stock due to the fact most kills are done via quickscoping anyways.
Lets the marksman do insane amounts of damage and 2 shot 8/9 classes, 6/9 at full overheal, and lets him do this constantly and consistently. (rip my goat)
Allows for free easy minicrits for the entire team from any range.

Secondary.notes: Banned when paired with the lemoblade.

Secondary.banReason: Free minicrits for no effort, allowing for easy high damage for the entire team.
Gives you full backstab immunity, denying Agent counters.
Gives you full afterburn immunity, denying Arsonist punishing bad positioning.

Melee.banReason: Gets the marksman in places he should not be in without needing to parkour or take risky positions.

Melee.notes: Banned when paired with the Supressed Solution/Citric Reaction

Primary.banReason: Free minicrits from anywhere simply for spamming pipes.
Bugged, fully banned until it gets fixed.
Double donks extremely easy against large groups, making it very easy to one-shot light classes simply by spamming.

Secondary.banReason: Lets the annihilator pose a constant threat from the enemy backline for no cost.

Secondary.notes: Mobile players banned from using shield due to turning bugs.
Secondary.banReason: Banned in PUGs unless your team is okay with it, as users were using shields to throw matches.

Secondary.notes: Mobile players banned from using shield due to turning bugs.
Secondary.banReason: Banned in PUGs unless your team is okay with it, as users were using shields to throw matches.

Secondary.notes: Mobile players banned from using shield due to turning bugs.
Secondary.banReason: Banned in PUGs unless your team is okay with it, as users were using shields to throw matches.

Secondary.notes: Mobile players banned from using shield due to turning bugs.
Secondary.banReason: Lets the annihilator instantly kill anyone he wants for no cost.

Secondary.notes: Mobile players banned from using shield due to turning bugs.
Secondary.banReason: Banned with grenade launchers due to poor replication. Banned in PUGs unless your team is okay with it, as users were using shields to throw matches.

Melee.banReason: Free speed and a 2x cap rate on a power class, busted when stacked.
Infinite charge simply for getting kills.

Primary.banReason: Direct upgrade to stock with the same damage, more clip-size, and buffs while jumping, all for slightly less blast radius.
Banned purely due to the charge shot one-tapping the doctor easily and with little skill.
Allows the user to bomb extremely easily and for little health, with an additional rocket on top of that.

Primary.notes: Banned if paired with Gunboats, Banned in Highlander due to Bugs
Primary.banReason: Banned due to overload jumping not taking away rockets, allowing for a infinite jumps and 3 rockets to bomb with once done.

Secondary.banReason: Direct upgrade to stock with higher damage and the ability to get an insane amount of clip size.
Deals minicrits to anyone blast jumping, which entirely prevents bombs for no cost.
Reliable damage with an insane amount of knockback, letting the pocket trooper deny most bombs.
Charges through both taking and dealing damage, rewarding playing stupidly.
Charges through taking damage, rewarding playing stupidly.

Melee.banReason: Free speed that gets you to mid faster, making winning positions easier.

Melee.notes: Banned if paired with Liberty Launcher

Primary.banReason: Too difficult to take down with the smaller teamsizes.
Brute should be punished when caught un-revved. Combined with the multitude of healing factors in Highlander and his high healthpool, the M249 disregards a core downside of the class.

Secondary.banReason: Direct upgrade to stock with higher damage and the ability to get an insane amount of clip size.
Overheal for the doctor, screws with damage calling and when to bomb.

Melee.banReason: Gives brute insane damage resistance which lets him play poorly and yet still be rewarded for it.
Gets brute into places he shouldn't even be without needing any risky jumps or movement.

Primary.banReason: Free crits without fully sacrificing airblast, still being able to delete projectiles.
Insanely high DPS at the cost of airblast, lets the arsonist be a better flanker.

Secondary.banReason: Direct upgrade to stock with higher damage and the ability to get an insane amount of clip size.

Primary.banReason: Direct upgrade to stock with higher damage and the ability to get an insane amount of clip size.
Lets the mechanic take potshots and do burn damage from any range.

Melee.banReason: Free metal and a Get out of jail free card, the best wrench hands down.
Lets the mechanic have leveled sentries be as replaceable as mini's against a team that cannot deal with it.

Secondary.banReason: Lets the doctor heal targets from ridiculoulsy far away, charges extremely fast, and gives minicrits allowing for easy kills even with spam.
Essentially a full supercharge only countered by a marksman or insanely heavy focus fire, and it charges faster.
Take no damage free card that is easy to use and abuse, as well as denying crits.

Primary.banReason: The Diamondback but in TC2, insane DPS simply for doing what an agent is supposed to do.
Annoying chip damage and bleed from anywhere, can genuinely bleed entire teams to backing off.

Cloak.banReason: A better deadringer; charges faster, instantly cloaks, and dashes forward which can be trimped and bhopped with, only costing the damage resistance.

Melee.banReason: Overheal for the doctor, insane burst healing, and very easy to get charges for.

PDA.banReason: Free wallhacks allowing for easy comms to the team about all enemy positions.
Full team wallhacks on a single target that if killed gives the agent a free crit. Encourages easy focus fire with a 180 damage shot coming right after.
